bomberman.title: Bomberman
bomberman.description: This project, developed in JavaFX, consisted of reproducing the Bomberman game according to precise specifications. The programme integrates various features: collision management, bomb inventory, health points system and dynamic interface.

artPourVivre.title: Art pour Vivre
artPourVivre.description: This website was designed in HTML and CSS as part of a university project carried out in a team of three. The goal was to develop a showcase site for a fictional company in the events sector. We created "Art pour Vivre", a company specializing in organizing art exhibitions across France.

l-o-rhone.title: L’Ô Rhône
l-o-rhone.description: Developed as part of a pair, this JavaFX application manages data for a water treatment plant. It allows users to manage customers, their orders and related information. This project enabled me to strengthen my skills in interface design and data structuring.

lens-symphony-web.title: LensSymphony
lens-symphony-web.description: Created by a team of three, this website promotes our Java application (as described in the Projects section). It is notable for its ability to read and utilise XML files generated by the application. The site includes a comprehensive CRUD as well as management of relationships between partitions and their arrangements, and also avatars for users, for example.

2048.description: This individual project was to recreate the game 2048 using JavaFX. I created a clear and intuitive interface that allows the user to play easily, while applying the mechanics of merging and moving tiles.

lightsoff.title: Lights Off
lightsoff.description: This game was developed individually in JavaFX. The goal was to design an interactive version of the ‘Lights Off’ puzzle. The application offers a simple but effective interface, allowing you to test your logic by trying to turn off all the lights.

pacman.title: Pac-Man
pacman.description: This group project (4 people) involved designing an adaptation of the Pac-Man game in JavaFX. The goal was to introduce and experiment with design patterns.

cinehub.title: CineHub
cinehub.description: Developed by four people, CineHub is our first website built with Laravel. We integrated a CRUD and a comment system, for example. This site allowed us to familiarise ourselves with Laravel.

osolsound.title: O-Sol-Sound
osolsound.description: This website was created in 36 hours by a group of seven students (three studying for a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science and four studying for a Bachelor's degree in Multimedia and Internet Professions). The project reproduces conditions similar to those found in the professional world: collaboration between unfamiliar teams, respect for specifications, management of different working methods (including CSS integration) and integration of an imposed musical constraint, bossa nova.

presentation.title: About me
presentation.description1: Hi, I'm Romain, I'm 19 years old. I'm currently a second-year Computer Science student at the IUT of Lens. I'm looking for an internship starting from April 13th, in the field of web development or application development.
presentation.description2: Alongside my studies, I’m passionate about several activities that help me grow both personally and professionally. I play table tennis in a team, a sport that has taught me mutual support, working together toward a common goal, and progressing individually at the same time. I also play chess (online), a discipline that strengthens my concentration, my ability to calculate several moves ahead, and to consider multiple possibilities instead of getting stuck on a single scenario.
presentation.description3: I also enjoy reading, especially novels; I even recommend “La promesse de l’aube” by Romain Gary, a book that left a strong impression on me. Finally, I’m a loyal supporter of the Racing Club de Lens: I love the idea of supporting the team and its players no matter what, through difficult moments as well as moments of glory.
